Instrument_Host.name: Mariner 9
Instrument_Host.description: The Mariner Mars 1971 spacecraft, weighing approximately 2238 lbs, was designed similarly to its predecessor, the Mariner Mars 1969, but included modifications for improved reliability, a 90-day operational lifetime, and different payload needs. It included 1050 lbs of propellant and a 152 lb science payload. The spacecraft featured various components such as four solar panels, multiple antennas, a maneuver engine, sensors, and propulsion tanks. Additionally, it had a scan platform that could articulate and was equipped with several scientific instruments, including an infrared radiometer and a UV spectrometer, allowing it to capture data across a wide range of angles.
